title: Why is the 2020 election 'historic'? - Quora
tags: Political History of the United States of America

response.answer_text: Every presidential election is historic. In America we have a 2 party system thanks to a history of first past the post winner take all polling. Every election holds the possibility of swinging policies for the next four years in one direction or even farther in the other direction. Another failing of American politics is the 2 term limit for presidents. In some ways it might stave off a tyrant, in others, it’s just a pointless exercise in wishful thinking and good intentions. The bad outcome of a 2 term limit is that the second term is relatively pointless for a returning incumbent. They can’t get elected again, so they don’t have to please any of their constituents…they just have to not break the law. If a president is good, why shouldn’t they get to run as many times as possible and let the voters vote them out? In any case, this election we have, in one corner — the experimental populist monster:  Something every Dunning-Kruger “political scientist” has been saying for decades: “Durrr, why don’t we just have a businessman in charge??” Who has done his darnedest to destroy the federal government as a sort of self-fulfilling prophecy of government incompetence and accidentally killed more Americans by a botched response to the pandemic—something that could have been a cake walk. The previous administration handed you a book: This is what you do, instead… To quote P-diddy from Made: “You turned an Easter-Egg hunt into a Butt-Fuck-A-Thon” In the other we have the VP from the before-time. He’s old. He’s centrist. But people like him, and the platform has been influenced by the now-reactionary left.  He’s the Wolf. He’s going to try to clean up after kid’s had a party and blew some kids’ brains all over the backseat of a car.  He doesn’t have to be good, he just has to be not a fucking asshole. I anticipate he’ll be good. Not perfect, not with America and it’s perpetual “dream”-state. (You know why they call it a dream, right?). You raise taxes 5% and then give them free healthcare at the point of service and you’ll probably lose your job. On the flipside, if the next person tries to take away that health care they’ll DEFINITELY lose their job. If the country is still here in 4 years after Biden’s been in office, it’s a success. Proto-fascism vs Democracy. That’s right, the Democrats are actually running on their name this year. The Republicans already printed T-Shirts  They would rather live in a totalitarian dictatorship than a place where you’re allowed to vote.  I used to think that the people saying “the soul of our country is at stake” were being hyperbolic. I’m with them this year. Trump and the GOP have played the fascist playbook to the hilt: Make X Great Again is nearly the exact slogan from the fascist party and Nazi party in Italy and GermanyPraising White supremacistsCreating “the other” as being the one ruining the country that he will save you from (China, mexico/south/central americans)Voter rights being revoked en masseDeath threats to his political opponentsSubverting the justice departmentSubverting impeachment proceedingsHe might’ve gotten away with it if he had gone full Hitler and taken emergency powers to control COVID, but instead he went the other way and decided to let America die, almost inexplicably. That said, he still might get away with it through the destruction of voter’s rights. Yeah, every election is historic. This one might be one of those. Hopefully these 4 years will be a forgettable blip that ends up reaffirming America in the long run. If nothing else Trump will be a reminder of the worst case scenario. And, to be frank, he’s ruined those old card games for me forever. I never learned to play bridge, now I don’t want to.

The 2020 election will be one of the two most critical elections ever held in our country. The other one was in 1860. The 1860 election led to secession and the formation of the CSA, followed by 4 brutal years of civil war costing hundreds of thousands of young Union and Confederate soldiers their lives. The 2020 election won’t lead to that but today voters will be deciding one vital issue that’s at the root of all the partisan clashes: Do we continue as a Constitutional republic or will the USA begin to morph into a Socialist state with increased societal controls dictated by Washington? Either way, after November 2020 look for more demonstrations and protests by the losing side.
